page.title: 03LANDSCAPE 2
page.content:
......................................
THE VILLAGE OF CADOXTON LIES APPROXIMATELY ONE MILE FROM THE TOWN OF NEATH ON THE WESTERN SIDE OF THE NEATH VALLEY.THE OLDER PART OF THE VILLAGE NESTLES AROUND THE CHURCH OF ST.CATWG WHICH HAS A MEDIAEVAL TOWER BUT SUBSEQUENT URBANIZATION HAS DEVELOPED AN EXTENDED VILLAGE ENVIRONMENT.THE VILLAGE HAS TWO PUBS,A SHOP,A POST OFFICE AND A SCHOOL ALL NEAR THE CHURCH AND THERE IS A PHOTOGRAPHIC PROCESSING LABORATORY AND SMALL ENGINEERING WORKSHOPS.THE LAND RISES FROM THE MARSHY BANKS OF THE RIVER NEATH TO GRAIG GWLADYS AND MYWYDD MARCH HWYWEL.ON THE HIGH GROUND ARE FARMS. ...................................... FOR MORE INFORMATION SEE LANDSCAPE 1 ......................................
